reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hap Dreams Apartments are a Wonderful find for those who want a little more freedom. Perched in the old part of Girona, We had an apartment overlooking the street. It was very quiet at night. The apartment was large with combined kitchen/dining/living area. Bedroom with a wonderful stone feature wall. Enough kitchen equipment to rustle up a decent breakfast or lunch. With tea/coffee, biscuits/croissant upon arrival. There is a nice garden area at the back which you can sit out in. There is also a wash-room downstairs where you can wash/dry your clothes if needed. The apartment has a hair-dryer, toiletries, free safe in bedroom. The towels are changed daily if required. And the owner Mr Ahmed is on hand if there are any problems.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

reviews.text: I would say the apartments are not suitable for those with walking difficulties, as there are many steps leading up to Portal Nou, I enjoyed it though as the area is so full of character with its winding stone streets (Although there is a lift, we never managed to locate it)
reviews.title: hidden gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lots of eateries, pubs and places of interest within walking distance. Le Cafe Bistro is a nice place to stop for a drink (5Euro for a beer & a wine) It is perched in the middle of the medievil steps leading up/down from Portal Nou, although we never ate there, it is very atmospheric of an evening sitting out on the steps with the flickers of candle light.
reviews.title: Great hotel , indifferent staff , parking nightmare

reviews.text: Upon arrival at Girona airport, we turned right as you leave the airport entrance, and a short walk away is the ticket kiosk. We purchased tickets there for 2 or 3 euoro (single) into Girona town. It took approx 20 minutes to arrive at Girona bus station.
reviews.title: Absolutely superb

reviews.text: All in all, a very relaxing break in an unpretentious charming little town. Reasonable prices for food & drinks. Would recommend the little train that takes you on a tour of the old town for orientation. Enjoy yourself......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for four(3!) nights - we took heed of the warnings about location and problems getting in - but still was a nightmare getting in. We had difficulty finding the place but got there eventually, about 1900. We entered our code and discovered no keys. We phoned the emergency number - no answer. Luckily we managed to get the holiday coy through whom we had booked. They managed to contact the manager who phoned us and told us there had just been a problem with our apartment door and he would arrange another apartment for the night. We spoke to a couple who came out at that moment and they had been put in the flat we had been allocated - at least two days before. Suspicious! On arrival at the emergency apartments - Historic Apartments - very nice - but noisy with the Cathedral bells - the manager told us we had been booked in two days before - so the Dream people knew of the problem but had not told us. If we had not had the travel company to deal with we would have had a nightmare getting this sorted.
reviews.title: Nice apartment pity about the communication and deceit

reviews.text: Otherwise the apartments were fine - just what we needed. Girona is lovely and well worth a visit.
reviews.title: fantastic location in a lovely city

reviews.text: After trailing a host of websites and reading many reviews I finally booked a short break at these apartments for my mother and my aunt. I cannot stress enough how helpful and accomodating the staff were. Through email communication I was given clear instructions how to get there, tips regarding public transport and recommendations for the duration of the stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful apartment, exceptionally helpful
Nice apartment - balcony & garden
reviews.text: My mother and aunt arrived and were made to feel very welcome indeed. They had a ground floor apartment with a patio and although it is the first time they have chosen not to go to a hotel, they thoroughly enjoyed the freedom it gave them. The apartments are central in the old town and they explored the town with its wonderful architecture, shops and eateries. They were most impressed with the restaurants and the value for money. The public transport was easily accessible and they took a trip to the coast with ease (without a single word of Spanish between them!). The apartment was cleaned and bed linen changed every day and they had everything they required for a most pleasurable stay. Again, the staff were on hand for any queries and most helpful and enthusiastic with suggestions to make it an enjoyable stay.
I would not hesitate in recommending the Hap Dreams Apartments to anyone wanting to explore this Catalonian jewell or its surrounding coastline.
reviews.title: lovely apartments

likes.liked: — clean, good position, value for money.

reviews.title: Loved the location
reviews.text: Just stayed 4 nights in duplex apartment (upstairs double and downstairs double sofa bed but we didn't care for only 120 Euros per night + 7% tax for a family of four). Small balcony and access to garden with shady decked area. Modern, clean, well equipped. Now has air conditioning (fitted earlier this year). The young lady who looks after the place was very efficient over the phone/E-mail to book and once we were there. The apartments are just inside the old city wall and no more than 5 mins down into the main part of the old town in the morning but the downside is that the steps back up are fairly steep.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for only one night at the hap dreams and would definitely go back and stay again. Lovely little apartment with a lounge and kitchen area downstairs with a table and chairs and sofa bed, then a bedroom, wardrobes and a bathroom upstairs. Kitchen very well equipped with crockery etc. and tea, coffee, biscuits, butter and water provided also. We had a small balcony which overlooked a garden just below the city walls - very pleasant!
reviews.title: Nice Apartments - Poor Communications

likes.disliked: — For a great meal try Draps restaurant nearby. Every item on the menu is designed to be shared between 2 or 3 people.
